uc:usecase.uc:name: Merchant Self Administration Login
uc:usecase.uc:goal: To enter the merchant self administration, you have to be authorized.
uc:usecase.uc:stakeholder: Merchant wants to enter the self administration. Merchants do not want others to enter their self administration.
Service Provider wants to enable only authorized merchants to enter only their self administration.

uc:guarantees.uc:success: Merchant has been authorized to enter the merchant self administration.
uc:guarantees.uc:minimal: Merchant is notified, why he cannot enter the self administration.

uc:success.uc:step: System prompts for user and password.
Merchant enters username and password and submits.
System returns to caller (calling use case).

uc:extension.name: INVALID USERNAME
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies an error to the Merchant that username or password is not valid.

uc:extension.name: INVALID PASSWORD
uc:extension.uc:step: System checks if failed login retry limit was exceeded.
System replies an error to the Merchant that username or password is not valid.

uc:extension.name: PASSWORD RETRY LIMIT EXCEEDED
uc:extension.uc:step: System locks the merchant administration account.
System notifies merchant that the account has been locked due to maximum retries with wrong password.
